page.title: 11WOLLATON
page.content: Wollaton was originally named{ {Olaveston}comprising 180 acres. It became known as Wollaton in{1176.}The{ {Willoughby}family acquired the manor but did not move in until 1460. They wer great land-owners and{Sir Henry {Willoghby}died one of the richest men in England.{St. Leonard's Church}dates from the 14th C. with a 15th C. tower built from sandstone quarried in {Trowell.} The first school was a grammar school which was flourishing in 1472. An infant school was started in 1841. The area is now served by a Infant, Junior and Comprehensive schools sharing the same campus. The sports ground, once owned by Mr. Wm. Wright, who acquired it from Lord Middleton in the 1800's, now has a bowling green and 3 tennis courts.
